perturbation.original_text: Operations Expense means all operating costs incurred in the operations of the Pharmacy (Wages, Taxes, and benefits of Pharmacist and or Pharmacy Tech, Liability Insurance of $100/month, miscellaneous expenses not exceeding $250/month, Fax, Phone, Internet, cost of supplies (Paper, cartridges, vials, vial caps, envelopes, prescription labels). The supplies costs are a flat fee of $0.75 per prescription filled). Operating costs exclude the cost of space and utilities.
perturbation.changed_text: Operations Expense means all operating costs incurred in the operations of the Pharmacy (Wages, Taxes, and benefits of Pharmacist and or Pharmacy Tech, miscellaneous expenses, Fax, Phone, Internet, cost of supplies). Operating costs exclude the cost of space and utilities.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'Liability Insurance of $100/month' eliminates a basic requirement for pharmacy operation, potentially violating Texas state laws regarding pharmacy liability coverage. Many states mandate minimum liability insurance for pharmacies, and the specific omission of the liability insurance clause creates a legal risk for the Customer.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Administrative Code ยง291.31(c)(1)(H) regarding minimum requirements for pharmacy operations and liability coverage.

perturbation.original_text: 3.11 Product Recalls. If the Company (or any Pharmaceutical Manufacturer) recalls any Products dispensed by the Kiosk, Smart RX Systems, Inc. will immediately contact the Pharmacist at the location to remove the recalled products and contact the customers.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.11 Product Recalls. If the Company (or any Pharmaceutical Manufacturer) recalls any Products dispensed by the Kiosk, Smart RX Systems, Inc. will immediately contact the Pharmacist at the location to remove the recalled products.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting 'and contact the customers,' the contract fails to ensure customers are notified of recalls, violating FDA guidelines and potentially state laws which mandate direct notification to patients in case of pharmaceutical recalls. This places the onus solely on the pharmacist and removes the company's direct legal responsibility.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 CFR Part 7, Subpart C - Specific Agency Action Regarding Recalls

perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW' attempts to exclude all implied warranties, including those that cannot be legally waived in Texas for certain goods or services.
